Nox Sétanta is Creative Minorem Explorer with Stealth who Uses Chaotic Magic

Tier: 1
Effort: 1
Armor: 0
XP: 4

Might: 7 / 13 (0)
Speed: 13 / 13 (1)
Intellect: 13 / 14 (1)

Addiction: (Caffeine) 3

Recovery 1d6 + Tier

  • Power Shift Healing 1 (triggers Chaos Aura)
  • Action (triggers Chaos Aura)
  • 10 Minutes
  • 1 hour
  • 10 hours

Damage Track

  • Impaired (effort costs +1, extra damage only +1)
  • Debilitated (no actions other than move)

Skills

  • practiced: light and medium weapons
  • trained: speed defense while wearing no armor, cooking, stealth, lockpicking, creating a narrative, drawing, puzzle-solving tasks, finding out something new, occult knowledge, dancing, runic knowledge and lore, healing
  • specialized:
  • inability: heavy weapons, pleasant social interaction, singing/musical talent, might defense

Asset

  • creatures who have been attacked this round in immediate range

Power Shifts

  • Single Attack: Attack rolls and damage (3 additional points per shift) -> Onslaught

Abilities

  • Rune Caster
  • Healing: You can administer aid through bandaging and other succor, attempting to heal each patient once per day. This healing restores points to a stat Pool of your choice.

Cyphers (4)

  • ?
  • L5 Analeptic: Restores a number of points equal to the cypher's level to the user's Speed Pool. (384) (SUBTLE)
  • L3 Darksight: Grants the ability to see in the dark for five hours per cypher level. (For a more realistic game, this cypher could instead make the user specialized in low-light spotting.) (386) (SUBTLE)
  • L1 Darksight: Grants the ability to see in the dark for five hours per cypher level. (For a more realistic game, this cypher could instead make the user specialized in low-light spotting.) (386) (SUBTLE)

Runes:

  • Personal Veil: an asset to staying hidden around mundanes

Notes
*

Attacks

  • unarmed (l), immediate 2 damage, eased (+2 Fists of Fury)
  • Medium Hand Gun (m), long 4 damage
  • Hunting Knife (l), immediate 2 damage, eased

Equipment

    • Laptop
    • Sketchbook and Pencils
    • Ammo (50 rounds)
    • Pocket Items
      • inexpensive: 2
      • moderate: 0

Player Intrusions (1XP)

  • Fortuitous Malfunction: A trap or a dangerous device malfunctions before it can affect you.
  • Serendipitous Landmark: Just when it seems like the path is lost (or you are), a trail marker, a landmark, or simply the way the terrain or corridor bends, rises, or falls away suggests to you the best path forward, at least from this point.
  • Weak Strain: The poison or disease turns out not to be as debilitating or deadly as it first seemed, and inflicts only half the damage that it would have otherwise.

Personality

Nox keeps to himself, but his extremely outgoing and flirty when he's out and about. Nox is afraid of heights, airplanes, needles and clowns.

Nox is allergic to shellfish

Nox has anger management issues.

Background and Story

Age: Young Adult (23)

Nox is born to a Venatori raised human mother by a Venatori father. He is given to the New York Venatori Head Quarters to raise after he catches fire to his childhood home. Nox has a twin brother.

Nox never really fits in. He keeps to himself and follows his instructions, but when he notices things work differently for him he finds creative ways to get around his limitations. These creative ways usually land him in hot water from his instructors and supervisors after graduation.

Nox's father is on the Venatori council and part of the ruling families with in the Venatori.

After graduation, Nox tends to work alone and trolls the human world looking for creative solutions to the problems he's tasked with solving that do not require him to kill all the monsters.

GM Note: Nox's mother is a non practicing Sussuri of the Gemini Line. (The Gemini Line always has twins who are born across the day and zodiac borders) she is also a Therianthropy carrier and passes the disease down to her children.

Character Arcs

Long Term Arc

THEFT

Someone else has something you want.

  • Opening: Setting Your Sights. You make a plan.
  • Step: Casing the Joint. You scout out the location of the thing (or learn its location).
  • Step(s): Getting to the Object. Sometimes, many steps are involved before you reach the object you wish to take. For example, if, in order to steal something from a vault, you need to approach one of the guards while they are off duty and bribe them to look the other way when you break in, that is covered in this step.
  • Climax: The Attempt. You make your heist.
  • Resolution: You decide what to do with the thing you've stolen and contemplate the repercussions you might face for stealing it.

Appearance

Hair: chestnut brown with the tips dyed a different color as he sees fit, styled tight at the sides with a high coifed do.
Eyes: chocolate brown, with long eye lashes and thick eyeliner
Height: 6'0"
Build: Athletic build, lean and toned body, narrow hips, long legs and arms, well sculpted muscles

Cross swords tattoo on his right temple

Ripped jeans, ratty gray hoodie with sarcastic t-shirts underneath and a pair of chucks.

Relationships

Person Relationship Notes

Character Journal

Tier 1

Descriptor: Creative

CREATIVE

Maybe you have a notebook where you write down ideas so you can develop them later. Perhaps you email yourself ideas that strike you out of the blue so you can sort them in an electronic document. Or maybe you just sit down, stare at your screen and, by indomitable force of will, produce something from nothing. However your gift works, you're creative—you code, write, compose, sculpt, design, direct, or otherwise create narratives that enthrall other people with your vision. (42)

You gain the following characteristics:

  • Inventive: +2 to your Intellect Pool.
  • Original: You're always coming up with something new. You're trained in any task related to creating a narrative (such as a story, play, or scenario). This includes deception, if the deception involves a narrative you're able to tell.
  • Skill: You are naturally inventive. You are trained in one specific creative skill of your choice: writing, computer coding, composing music, painting, drawing, and so on.
  • Skill: You love solving riddles and the like. You are trained in puzzle-solving tasks.
  • Skill: To be creative requires that you always be learning. You are trained in any task that involves finding out something new, such as when you're digging through a library, data bank, news archive, or similar collection of knowledge.
  • Inability: You're inventive but not charming. All tasks related to pleasant social interaction are hindered.

Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

You were doing research for a project and convinced your superiors to let you go.

Background: Your father is a high-ranking officer in the military with many connections.
